snippet: The measures take aim at financial, defense and industrial companies at the vanguard of a push by the Russian leader to replace wild free-market capitalism with state-led development.
abstract: United States and European Union broaden and deepen range of sanctions imposed on Russia in retaliation for its intervention in Ukraine; measures deal blow to Russian efforts to develop future oil sources in Arctic and elsewhere, and place further limits on access to American and European capital markets.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and ANDREW HIGGINS
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Andrew Higgins from Brussels. Reporting was contributed by Andrew E. Kramer and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow; Neil MacFarquhar from Kiev, Ukraine; and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: The measures take aim at financial, defense and industrial companies at the vanguard of a push by the Russian leader to replace wild free-market capitalism with state-led development.

headline.main: U.S. and European Sanctions Take Aim at Putin’s Economic Efforts
headline.print_headline: New Round of Sanctions Target Energy in Russia
